text: Navaṃ pana bhikkhunā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānena aṭṭhaṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugataṅgulena aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā
edit: Navaṃ pana bhikkhunā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānena aṭṭhaṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugataṅgulena aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā

translations.transtext: 87. When a bhikkhu is having a new bed or bench made, it is to have legs (at most) eight fingerbreadths long — using sugata fingerbreadths — not counting the lower edge of the frame.
๘๗. อนึ่ง ภิกษุผู้ให้ทําเตียงก็ดีตั่งก็ดี ใหม่พึงทําให้มีเท่าเพียง ๘ นิ้ว ด้วยนิ้วสุคต เว้นไว้แต่แม้แคร่เบื้องต่ำ
87. When a bhikkhu is having a new bed or bench made it must be made with legs eight fingers of the sugata-finger high excepting the frame below.
